ef608.content:
The floral wallpaper of your Wolverhampton bedroom swims into focus as a shaft of sunlight pierces through a gap in the curtains. You're sprawled amongst the duvet, blissfully unaware of the momentous day ahead. That is, until the radio alarm clock on your bedside table crackles to life. 

'Good morning, Wolverhampton! And a *very* good morning it is, because today, ladies and gentlemen, the wait is over! Lionel Richie's brand new album has officially dropped!' The DJ's voice, buzzing with excitement, slices through your sleep-addled brain. Lionel Richie! The new album! Your eyes snap open. How could you have forgotten? This is a disaster! You simply *must* get your hands on a copy today. Your quest begins now, in Wolverhampton.

choices.content: Grope for the radio, desperate to hear more.
Mutter and bury your head under the pillow, feigning ignorance.

alarming_announcement_entry_2a.content: You groan, burying your head under the pillow. The DJ's voice is relentless, but you're clinging to the hope of a few more minutes of sleep. Lionel can wait, surely. But the nagging feeling that today is *the* day is hard to ignore. You can just about make out the DJ mentioning something about 'Spin City' and a 'special promotion'.

choices.content: Give in and listen to the radio.
Try to drift back to sleep, dreams of Lionel fading away.

e1958.content: The radio DJ's voice, now even more irritatingly upbeat, cuts through your grogginess. '...and don't forget folks, a special release day promotion down at 'Spin City' record store! Get yourselves down there for a chance to win...' The words 'Lionel Richie' and 'special promotion' finally register. It hits you like a bucket of cold water. You completely forgot! Today is the release day, and you haven't even pre-ordered a copy. A true fan in Wolverhampton is about to face a major crisis.

choices.content: Leap out of bed in a panic – there's no time to lose! Lionel Richie awaits!
Calmly assess the situation – what's the best course of action to secure the album?

alarming_announcement_entry_3a.content: A wave of pure, unadulterated panic washes over you. How could you be so forgetful? Lionel Richie deserves better than this! You leap out of bed with a start, instantly regretting your life choices. This is a disaster of epic proportions!

choices.content: Rush out of bed without looking – speed is key!
Frantically search for your keys and wallet – gotta be prepared.

e00af.content:
In your haste, you trip over a pile of clothes carelessly strewn across the floor – mostly old band t-shirts and forgotten socks. You nearly fall headfirst, narrowly avoiding a collision with the bedside table. This day is off to a truly terrible start.

Fully awake and fueled by a mixture of panic and excitement, you're now determined to secure a copy of Lionel Richie's new album. The chain record store in the city centre – 'Spin City' – is the obvious first stop. It's time to begin your quest.

choices.content: Consider a quick shower – wouldn't want to offend anyone's nostrils.
Grab a quick coffee – need the caffeine boost for this mission.

chain_store_letdown_entry_1a.content: You contemplate a quick shower, picturing the refreshing spray washing away the sleep-induced fog. But no, time is of the essence! Every second counts in the quest for the new Lionel Richie album. You decide to forgo the hygiene and embrace the urgency. You're still in your bedroom, perhaps smelling slightly of sleep and desperation.

choices.content: Wonder if showering would have somehow brought you good Richie-finding luck.
Check your hair in the mirror – gotta look presentable, even if you're a bit ripe.

alarming_announcement_entry_2b.content: You blindly reach for the radio, desperate to silence the DJ's intrusive cheer. Sleep is precious! But your clumsy fingers only manage to make things worse. You accidentally crank the volume up, sending a deafening blast of 'All Night Long' ricocheting around the room.

choices.content: Stumble out of bed to try and turn it down again.
Succumb to the music's infectious rhythm.

e1bca.content:
The sudden, deafening burst of Lionel sends a jolt through your system, instantly dispelling any lingering sleepiness. Ears ringing, you finally manage to wrestle the volume knob back under control. The radio now whispers its unwelcome news.

Sleep defeated, you drag yourself up, burying your face in a pillow in a futile attempt to recapture a few more moments of peace. But the insistent whisper of Lionel's music, now a personal affront, is impossible to ignore. The nagging feeling that today is *the* day is hard to shake. The DJ is now plugging 'Spin City' record store and a 'special promotion'.

choices.content: Grumble and listen to the radio.
Try to drift back to sleep anyway.

e0306.content:
Despite your best efforts, you drift back into a fitful doze. You dream of dancing on the ceiling with Lionel Richie, but even in your dream state, a nagging feeling of forgotten responsibilities casts a shadow. The dream quickly fades.

The radio DJ's announcement, now just a faint echo, hits you with the force of a cold bucket of water. You completely forgot! Today is the release day of Lionel Richie's new album, and you haven't even pre-ordered a copy. You are failing as a true fan in Wolverhampton. Panic sets in.

choices.content: Leap out of bed, ready to face the music.
Try to calmly assess the damage.

alarming_announcement_entry_3b.content: You take a deep breath, attempting to calmly assess the situation. Panicking won't get you anywhere. You *can* still get a copy of the new album, surely? Optimism, however fragile, flickers in your heart. A plan begins to form.

choices.content: Take a moment for a luxurious stretch and yawn.
Grab your phone to check for local news on the album release.

chain_store_letdown_entry_1b.content: You decide a quick coffee is non-negotiable. Stumbling into the tiny kitchenette in your Wolverhampton bedroom, you spoon instant granules into a chipped mug, the aroma barely cutting through the lingering scent of sleep. The kettle screeches, and you pour the boiling water, the dark liquid promising focus.

choices.content: Chuck in a spoonful of Tate & Lyle.
Bravely take a scalding sip.

e3881.content:
You hover the sugar bowl over your mug, then think better of it. You need clarity, not a sugar rush. A pure, unadulterated caffeine hit is the order of the day. You down the coffee in three burning gulps and grab your keys, ready to face Wolverhampton. 

The 'Spin City' chain store looms before you, a glass and steel temple to chart-topping mediocrity. Inside, the air hums with generic pop music. You spot a young employee with carefully sculpted hair behind the counter. 'Lionel Richie's new album?' you ask, hopefully. He barely glances up from his phone. After a cursory tap on the keyboard, he delivers the blow. 'Sold out. Pre-orders, limited stock, you know how it is.'

choices.content: Scan the racks for a 'Now That's What I Call Lionel!' compilation.
Briefly consider asking if he knows any other Wolverhampton record shops that might have it.
Overhear a disgruntled customer complaining about Ed Sheeran.

chain_store_letdown_entry_2c.content: Your gaze drifts to a brightly coloured display nearby. Nestled amongst the Sam Smith and Taylor Swift CDs, you spot a 'Now That's What I Call Lionel!' compilation. It's a tempting fallback option, a comforting reminder of past glories. But it's not the new album, is it?

choices.content: Flick through the tracklist, hoping for a rare B-side.
Start humming 'Dancing on the Ceiling' under your breath.

e1991.content:
You scan the tracklist on the back of the compilation, your eyes darting for hidden gems. Maybe there's a live recording, an extended mix, something to justify the purchase. But no, it's just the usual hits. 'Hello', 'Easy', 'Three Times a Lady'... classics, sure, but nothing new.

You step out of 'Spin City' and onto the busy Wolverhampton street. The weight of your failure begins to sink in. The new album is proving elusive. This isn't going to be as easy as you thought. The Wolverhampton music scene suddenly feels a lot more challenging.

'Spin City' recedes behind you, its generic facade blending into the cityscape. You start walking north, towards the University Quarter, where a smaller, independent record shop might offer a glimmer of hope.

choices.content: Whip out your phone and search for other record stores in Wolverhampton.
Continue towards the University Quarter.

ef882.content:
You pull out your phone and tap furiously, searching for 'record shops Wolverhampton'. Google Maps spits out a list, but most are too far out of the city centre to be practical. Except for 'Vinyl Vortex', nestled in the heart of the student area. It's worth a shot.

'Vinyl Vortex' is a different world. The air is thick with the smell of incense and old vinyl. Psychedelic posters adorn the walls, and obscure indie bands blare from the speakers. A long-haired employee with multiple piercings stands behind the counter, looking supremely unimpressed with everything.

choices.content: Rummage through the racks of limited edition vinyl.
Check out the poster for a local band, 'Concrete Canary'.

chain_store_letdown_entry_2a.content: While the employee taps away at his phone, you overhear another customer nearby. He's red-faced and muttering about the 'pathetic' vinyl selection. "Honestly," he says to himself, loud enough for you to hear, "they call this a record shop? They haven't got anything beyond Ed Sheeran!"

choices.content: Nod in agreement and subtly roll your eyes at the employee.
Consider starting a vinyl collection to broaden your music horizons.

e4b30.content:
You share a knowing look with the disgruntled customer. Vinyl is the superior format, everyone knows that. Although this small act of solidarity does little to improve your mood, or your chances of finding the album. Disappointment washes over you as you leave the 'Spin City' chain store. The Wolverhampton music scene suddenly seems a lot more challenging than you first thought. 

The 'Spin City' chain store fades into the background as you start walking. You decide to head towards the University Quarter, hoping an independent record store might have better luck, but first, you need a plan.

choices.content: Check your phone for alternative record shops in Wolverhampton.
Continue towards the University Quarter.

e06ef.content:
You pause to listen to a busker outside 'Spin City'. He's strumming a slightly off-key rendition of "Easy Like Sunday Morning" on an acoustic guitar. He's giving it his all, but it doesn't really lift your spirits. The thought of finding that Lionel Richie album is still paramount. You decide to move on towards the University Quarter, hoping for better luck.

You arrive at 'Vinyl Vortex', an independent record store nestled amongst the cafes and student flats of the University Quarter. The air is thick with the smell of incense and something vaguely herbal. The walls are plastered with vinyl records and posters for local bands you've never heard of, and there's a distinct lack of anything mainstream or 'pop'.

choices.content: Browse the seemingly endless racks of vinyl.
Check out the poster for local band, 'Concrete Canary'.

e3283.content:
You scan the vinyl selection, noticing a distinct lack of anything resembling Lionel Richie. There's plenty of obscure indie bands, classic rock, and even a surprisingly large selection of polka records, but no sign of anything remotely resembling "Dancing on the Ceiling". You approach the counter, where a long-haired employee with multiple piercings is meticulously cleaning a record with a soft cloth.

You ask the employee about the new Lionel Richie album. He stops cleaning the record and gives you a slightly surprised look. "Lionel Richie?" he says, checking a list behind the counter. "Blimey, we had a few copies in this morning, but they all sold out. Didn't expect that much demand for him, to be honest."

You remain in 'Vinyl Vortex', having already tried another record store earlier today.

choices.content: Ask the employee if he knows where to find the album online.
Listen to the employee complain about hipsters buying up all the vinyl.

eda28.content:
The employee suggests checking online marketplaces like Discogs or eBay. "You might get lucky," he says, with a hint of skepticism. You sigh, explaining that you're really hoping to find a physical copy today. He shrugs and returns to cleaning his record.

You leave 'Vinyl Vortex' feeling more concerned than ever. The album is proving stubbornly elusive. You've already tried one record store, with no luck. You stand on the pavement outside the shop, considering your next move. Should you try that dusty second-hand vinyl shop down the alley, or investigate the rumours you heard about new albums turning up at a local charity shop?

choices.content: Head to the local charity shop, hoping the rumours are true.
Brave the depths of the second-hand vinyl shop down the alley.

chain_store_letdown_entry_2b.content: You briefly consider asking the disinterested employee if they know of any other record stores in Wolverhampton that might have the album, but his glazed-over expression suggests he wouldn't know or care if Lionel Richie himself walked through the door. His world begins and ends with whatever's trending on TikTok, you suspect. Best not to waste your breath.

choices.content: Vow to search for record stores on your phone later, away from his judgemental gaze.
Remember a friend mentioning a cool record store near the university, full of 'vinyls' and 'vibes'.

e17b1.content:
You decide to look up a map of Wolverhampton's record stores on your phone later, hoping to find some hidden gems 'Spin City' wouldn't even know about. Places that understand the *true* artistry of Lionel. You exit the chain record store, a wave of disappointment washing over you. The realization that the album might be harder to find than expected begins to sink in. The Wolverhampton music scene suddenly seems a lot more challenging.

You exit the chain store, feeling deflated. The album is proving harder to find than expected. You begin walking towards the student area, hoping an independent record store might have better luck. The generic pop music from 'Spin City' fades into the background.

choices.content: Whip out your phone and frantically search for 'record shops Wolverhampton' before you forget.
Continue towards the University Quarter.

You briefly wonder if the band members might have a secret stash of the new Lionel Richie album, perhaps as an ironic statement, but dismiss the thought as highly unlikely.

Blimey, we had a few copies in this morning, but they all sold out. Didn't expect that much demand for him, to be honest."

choices.content: Probe the employee about where else you might find the album, perhaps online.

You overhear the employee talking to a colleague in hushed tones. "Yeah, Lionel Richie...sold out in hours. Apparently, there's a rumour going around that some local superfan bought up all the stock. Crazy, innit? They're saying he's got a lock-up full of them somewhere in Bilston."

You exit 'Vinyl Vortex', feeling more concerned than ever. The album is proving stubbornly elusive. You've already tried one record store, with no luck. You consider your next move. Should you brave the depths of that dusty second-hand vinyl shop down the alley, or investigate the rumours about new albums turning up at a local charity shop?

Plunge into the second-hand shop.

charity_shop_win_entry_donate.content: Elated by your unexpected find, you feel a surge of goodwill. A collection tin sits on the counter, overflowing with spare change. You spot a faded sign explaining the charity supports local musicians in Wolverhampton. It feels like the right thing to do.

choices.content: Head outside and quickly scan the CD.
Drop some coins into the collection tin.

ebfaf.content:
You briefly consider slipping the CD out of its case and holding it up to the light, checking for scratches. But you decide against it; better to wait until you get home and can blast it out on your stereo, the way Lionel intended.

Clutching the album tightly, you stand on the Wolverhampton pavement outside the shop. It feels substantial, weighty – the perfect reward for a morning's hard work.

choices.content: Step out into the sunshine, humming 'Dancing on the Ceiling'.
Check the bus timetable at the stop across the road.

ec22a.content:
The sun, breaking through the clouds over Wolverhampton, seems to celebrate your victory. You grin, feeling utterly triumphant. You've done it. You secured the new Lionel Richie album.

Your quest is complete. You pause outside the charity shop, savouring the moment. Wolverhampton, and the world, are yours!

e2d56.content: For a fleeting moment, you consider giving up the physical quest and resorting to streaming. But the thought is quickly banished. A true fan celebrates release day with a tangible copy! Your mind flicks back to a second-hand record shop tucked away down a back alley off Dudley Street. It's a long shot, but you're running out of options.

choices.content: Stop to look at the poster for a local band, weighing your options.
Carefully step around a precarious stack of milk crates on the pavement.
Follow a strange smell wafting from a doorway, which you think is coming from the record shop.

As you turn into the alley, a tattered poster catches your eye. 'The Manky Ponchos' are playing at 'The Dog & Doublet' next week. You briefly consider checking it out – a distraction from your Richie-related woes. But no, focus! The album awaits.

You finally arrive at the second-hand record shop. Piles of vinyl, CDs, and tapes are crammed into every available space, visible through the grime-streaked window. It smells faintly of dust, damp cardboard, and forgotten dreams.

choices.content: Notice the barely-hanging, faded "Open" sign, then push the door open.
Hesitantly push the door open and enter the shop.
Take a peek through the window first.

ea296.content:
You notice a faded "Open" sign hanging crookedly in the window, barely attached by one rusty nail. It looks like it's been there since the 80s, probably around the time Lionel was at his peak. You push the door open, a bell tinkling faintly above your head, announcing your arrival.

Inside, the shop is even more cluttered than it appeared from the outside. The owner, a slightly dishevelled man with a long beard, is engrossed in sorting through a stack of jazz records behind the counter. He seems completely oblivious to your presence, lost in his own world of bebop and blues. Given his lack of awareness of current music, you don't hold out much hope of him having the new Lionel Richie album.

choices.content: Examine a box overflowing with old cassette tapes, then leave the shop.
Leave the shop and head to the Wolverhampton Outdoor Market.

You spot a few 80s classics: *Rio* by Duran Duran, *True* by Spandau Ballet. A pang of nostalgia hits, but these relics won't help you secure the new Lionel Richie album.

Emerging from the shop, you find yourself in the bustling Wolverhampton Outdoor Market. A wave of sounds and smells washes over you – the shouts of vendors hawking their wares, the aroma of frying onions, the general hubbub of shoppers. Amidst the fruit and veg stalls and clothing vendors, you spot various places to browse.

Listen to the busker's rendition of a classic hit.

You can barely make out a path through the labyrinth of forgotten sounds.

choices.content: Spot the faded "Open" sign, hanging by a thread, and push the door open.
Hesitantly brave the chaos and step inside.

He's more likely to know obscure B-sides from the 60s than the latest Lionel Richie album.

Realising this shop is a dead end for finding the new Lionel Richie album, you leave and head to Wolverhampton's outdoor market, hoping for a stroke of luck.

choices.content: Examine the box of old cassette tapes by the door, then leave the shop.
Leave the shop and listen in on the snippets of market-goers' conversations.

Emerging from the shop, you arrive at the bustling Wolverhampton Outdoor Market. Amongst the fruit and veg stalls and clothing vendors, you spot various places to browse.

choices.content: Browse the colourful fruit displays.
Listen to the busker's off-key rendition of "Easy Like Sunday Morning".

Drawn in by the vibrant colours, you pause at a fruit stall piled high with plums, peaches, and nectarines. You briefly consider buying a punnet of juicy local plums, but the thought of Lionel Richie snaps you back to reality. Fruit can wait; Richie can't.

You approach the makeshift CD stall. The stallholder, a shifty-looking character with a gold tooth and a knowing glint in his eye, is meticulously arranging his wares. You take a deep breath and ask: 'Got the new Lionel Richie album, by any chance?' The stallholder's expression changes, and he glances around nervously.

choices.content: Watch the stallholder's reaction closely as you mention Lionel Richie.
Scan the DVDs on display while the stallholder considers your question.

e79e2.content:
The stallholder's eyes dart left and right, like a startled rabbit, before he leans in conspiratorially. His sudden caution only heightens your suspicion – is this a legitimate business, or something a little more…under the table?

You are now fully engaged with the shifty market stallholder, having inquired about the elusive Lionel Richie album. Your search has led you to a potentially untrustworthy source in the heart of Wolverhampton market. However, he avoids giving you a straight answer, and you're left feeling unsure about your next move.

choices.content: Give up on the market and head to the "Dancing on the Ceiling" pub.
Press him about the possibility of a "secret stash".

secret_storage_unit_entry_market_stall_c.content: You decide to play it cool, attempting to strike up a conversation with the stallholder. You hope to glean some insight into the local music scene. choices.content: Probe the stallholder about the vinyl collecting scene in Wolverhampton.
Ask about local Wolverhampton bands, and any success they've had.

e5fc4.content:
You try to subtly steer the conversation towards the local vinyl collecting community. You mention your quest for the new Lionel Richie album, hoping someone might have a lead on where to find rare or hard-to-find records.

Just as you're about to write the stallholder off as a dead end, he leans in, his gold tooth glinting in the Wolverhampton sunlight. He whispers that he might know someone who has a 'stash' of albums in a storage unit on the outskirts of town. He pauses, then adds, 'Information like that doesn't come free, mate.'

choices.content: Press him for more details about this 'Mick' and the storage unit.

Despite your misgivings, you agree to meet 'Mick'. You follow the stallholder's directions, arriving at a desolate area on the outskirts of Wolverhampton. Your mind races, considering what would cause such a deliberate hoarding or unusual distribution of the album.

A nervous-looking man, presumably Mick, fidgets by a chain-link fence. He's wearing a tracksuit and keeps glancing around. He finally makes eye contact and beckons you over. Mick leads you towards a row of identical, grey storage units.

choices.content: Question Mick’s trustworthiness, sensing something is not right.
Try to put Mick at ease and get a feel for the situation by asking him about music.

Consider Mick’s connection to the stallholder, wondering if he is trustworthy.

The air is thick with the smell of damp cardboard and dust, with a faint hint of something else in the air. It seems like a lot of merchandise for one person.

Check out the framed 'Can't Slow Down' album cover hanging above the bar and other memorabilia.

e671a.content: The poster shouts about 'Lionel Libations' – two-for-one cocktails all night – and a 'Hello, Is It Quiz You're Looking For?' trivia night later in the week. A pub this dedicated to Lionel Richie *must* be worth investigating. You step inside 'Dancing on the Ceiling' to the sound of someone attempting 'Dancing on the Ceiling' on a karaoke machine. The barman, wiping down the counter, is humming along. He looks up as you approach. You ask, perhaps a little too eagerly, if he knows where you could possibly find a copy of the new album. He grins. "Barry? The owner? He's the *biggest* Lionel Richie fan I know. Pre-ordered loads, he did."

choices.content: Ask the barman if *he's* a big Lionel Richie fan.
Ask the barman if you can speak to Barry.

charity_shop_rumours_entry_charity_start.content: Outside 'Vinyl Vortex', your earlier confidence begins to wane. The thought of giving up flickers momentarily, but then 'Dancing on the Ceiling' begins to play in your head, reminding you why you started this quest. You won't be defeated! Just then, as you stand on the pavement in Wolverhampton, you overhear two people chatting nearby. "...apparently, the Age UK on Broad Street got a whole box of new CDs by mistake," one says. "New CDs? In a charity shop?" the other replies, incredulous. Could this be the answer?

choices.content: Overcome your hesitation and head straight for the bus station to get to Broad Street.
Decide it's too unlikely and head to the pub for a pint, figuring you can stream it later.

secret_storage_unit_entry_market_stall_a.content: The stallholder purses his lips, stroking his chin. 'Lionel Richie, eh? Bit before my time, that. Still,' he adds, glancing around again, 'I might know someone who knows someone... Heard whispers of a stash. Down by the storage units, outskirts of town. Friend of a friend, see? Name's Mick.' He scribbles a number on a scrap of paper, avoiding your gaze. 'Don't say you got it from me, alright?'

choices.content: Try to get more information about the 'local music scene' from the stallholder.
Casually check out the stall for anything that might hint at this 'stash'.

storage_unit_stash_entry_storage_unit_02.content: Despite the mild weather, a shiver runs down your spine. The air inside the storage unit feels heavy, like a Wolverhampton fog, but thicker, laced with unspoken secrets and a palpable sense of wrongness. You can't shake the feeling that you're involved in something shady, like a dodgy market deal gone south.

choices.content: Push down the guilt, reminding yourself that you're here for the album, whatever it takes.
Spot a glint of metal in the corner of the unit: a security camera, its unblinking eye fixed on you.

e92f5.content:
While the volunteer rings up the album, you glance at the towering shelves crammed with yellowing paperbacks. Titles like 'Knitting with Cats' and 'The History of Wolverhampton's Canals' vie for your attention. The air hangs heavy with the scent of aged paper and a faint, indefinable mustiness.

Finally, the volunteer calls you back. You hand over £2.99, the new Lionel Richie album now officially yours. A wave of satisfaction washes over you, but you are so eager to play the album that you consider checking it before you leave the shop.

choices.content: Whip out your phone and quickly check if the CD is legit.
Donate the spare change jingling in your pocket to the charity.
Give the cover one last, meticulous examination.

eaf44.content: You ask him to sing a few lines from his favourite song. Barry throws his head back and obliges, belting out 'Oh, what a feeling, when we're dancing on the ceiling!' slightly off-key but with unrestrained enthusiasm. His face is beaming.

choices.content: Tell Barry that his love of Lionel Richie is inspiring.
Ask if he's always been such a big fan.

e1bec.content: The thought of giving up flickers momentarily. You're disheartened by the lack of Lionel Richie's new album. But then, 'Dancing on the Ceiling' begins to play in your head, a defiant earworm reminding you why you started this quest. You won't be defeated! Just then, as you stand on the pavement in Wolverhampton, you overhear two people chatting nearby. "...apparently, the Age UK on Broad Street got a whole box of new CDs by mistake," one says. "New CDs? In a charity shop?" the other replies, incredulous. Could this be the answer?

choices.content: Edge closer to the pair to eavesdrop on their conversation about Age UK.
Consider the charity shop rumour, but remain sceptical.

ee7bd.content:
You lean closer to the poster outside 'Dancing on the Ceiling'. The words 'Lionel Richie Album Release Party' are emblazoned in glittery lettering, and beneath, in smaller print, you see the crucial detail: 'TODAY!'. A surge of adrenaline courses through you. This could be it! You push open the door, the familiar strains of 'Dancing on the Ceiling' washing over you.

Inside, a barman with a neatly trimmed moustache polishes glasses, humming along to the music. You approach the bar, trying to sound casual. "Excuse me," you say, "do you happen to know where a person might find the new Lionel Richie album?"

The barman stops polishing, a wide grin spreading across his face. "Lionel, eh? You've come to the right place! Barry, the owner, is a *massive* fan. Pre-ordered loads of copies, he did."

choices.content: Ask the barman if *he's* a big Lionel Richie fan.
Ask the barman if you can speak to Barry.

dusty_depths_entry_dusty_start.content: Leaving 'Vinyl Vortex', you find yourself standing in a narrow alleyway, the air thick with the smell of damp brick and discarded chips. A sign, barely legible through the grime, points to 'Vinyl Paradise', a second-hand record shop promising 'Hidden Gems'. Two record stores have turned up empty, but you're determined to continue the hunt for Lionel. The shop's doorway is ajar, beckoning you into its shadowy depths.

choices.content: Admit defeat and head home to stream the album, resolving to pre-order next time.
Consult your phone for other record stores in Wolverhampton, clinging to the hope of finding a physical copy.

storage_unit_stash_entry_storage_unit_02.content: A pang of guilt hits you. You're potentially supporting something dodgy just to get your hands on a record. But the desire for the new Lionel Richie album overpowers your conscience. You're in too deep now, the die is cast.

choices.content: Ruminate on the implications of so many albums being stored here.
Sniff the air, trying to identify that strange smell in the storage unit.

e587c.content:
A charity shop selling new albums seems far-fetched. You can't shake the feeling this is some kind of prank, perhaps orchestrated by a rival Lionel fan trying to throw you off the scent. But the desperation is setting in, and the thought of hearing Lionel's smooth vocals is too tempting to ignore.

The rumour of the charity shop stash feels like the only lead you have left. You are still in Wolverhampton, and despite the unlikelihood of it all, the Age UK on Broad Street is now your best bet. You must decide whether to pursue this strange tip-off, or try another record shop first.

choices.content: Try a different record shop, even though the others have failed you.
Head to Broad Street, ready to sift through the charity shop's unlikely treasure trove.

e66e7.content:
You stretch, feeling the Wolverhampton sun warm your face through the window. A true Lionel Richie fan deserves to feel relaxed before embarking on this quest. But the DJ's words echo in your mind: 'Spin City' record store, special promotion! You need to get moving. Quickly now! The thought of securing that new album is all that matters.

You are now fully awake, fueled by a mixture of panic and excitement. Your mission is clear: secure a copy of Lionel Richie's new album. You hurriedly throw on some clothes, ready to begin your quest. The large chain record store in the city centre seems like the most obvious starting point.

choices.content: Hop in the shower; smelling nice for this occasion is important.
Stumble into the kitchen and brew some coffee, fortification is essential.

title: Richie Retrieval
description: A quest to find the elusive new Lionel Richie album in the heart of Wolverhampton.
